googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Maine driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox6: Enter your Maine driver's license number. If you don't have one, enter the last 4 digits of your Social Security Number. If you don't have either number, write "NONE" in this space.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules: Any registered Maine voter can request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfSubmissionAddress:
Elections Division  
Bureau of Corporations, Elections and Commissions  
101 State House Station  
Augusta, ME 04333‐0101
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting: Most Maine voters do not need to show ID.  First time Maine voters should plan on showing ID at the polls. Acceptable forms of photo ID include: a drivers license from any state, a US passport, a government ID card, a military ID card, a tribal ID card, or a student ID card from an accredited college or university.  Acceptable forms of non-photo ID include a recent utility bill, bank statement, government check, paycheck, or other government document that shows your name and Maine address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmWarnings: Your local election office will compare your signature on your voted ballot to the one on your driver’s license.  If the signatures don't match, your ballot might be rejected.  Please sign carefully.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.year2020LegalChanges: For the November 3, 2020 election, the deadline to return a registration application sent by mail is now received by October 19, 2020.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox7: You must register with a party if you want to take part in that party’s primary election, caucus, or convention (unless otherwise permitted by a political party).
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm: Maine voters do not need to provide ID when voting by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Maine you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be a resident of Maine and the municipality in which you want to vote
  * be 17 years old (you must be at least 18 years of age to vote, except that in primary elections you may vote if you are 17 but will be 18 by the general election)
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationDeadlineMail: Received 21 business days before Election Day
